content.description: Awesome overhung problem on the approach to Lizard Tail.  Start on sandstone jughandle.  Perform a levered spring out to a baseball-sized knob, match hands, and follow horizontals to the top.  Feet out left in the beginning, or campus for full value!  Great big jughandle to top out.  I'm not much of a boulderer so V3 is my best guess.  Let me know what you think about the grade if you get on it!
content.location: The wall just off the path on your right as you approach Lizard Tail.  On the saddle between Chimney Rock & LT.  15min approach.  Definitely more bouldering potential here (if not already developed?), this one just stood out.

content.description: Awesome afternoon sun on this west facing wall!  Hook the heel, pull the mellow roof move on jugs, set your feet & paddle to the top.  Careful what you crank on!
content.protection: Another really sloped landing.  2 pads and good spotters!  Or just don't fall!
content.location: Opposite side of the obvious overhang from Way of the Warrior.  This problem faces southwest.  Easy gully to scramble down to the south.

content.description: This is the 10'  - 30' tall flat topped wall on the approach to Lizard Tail Spire.
